column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=In my riding the Liberal MPP Jim Watson poses the biggest challenge .
#Text=He is the incumbent , and has been a politician for many years .
#Text=I 'm only the most desirable candidate for those voters who care about creating an economically and environmentally sustainable society in the long term .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The issues which individuals care about are very diverse .

#Text=The most important issues for those who are likely to vote Green are likely to be : a taxation plan which does not hit incomes , but directly targets non-renewable resource consumption — and in conjunction with incentives to reduce consumption , initiatives to replace dirty energy with clean , renewable energy sources ; a single public school system which has the democratic interests of all Ontarians as its primary concern ; and an emphasis on livable communities which promote walking and public transit , decreased levels of pollution , and increased opportunities for healthy activities .
#Text=It 's all about sustainability , economically , politically , and personally .
#Text=Our party platform contains specific details on how these issues would be addressed .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=The first order of business should be to begin shifting taxes away from personal income , health care , and corporate profit , and onto the consumption of resources .

#Text=Specifically , our taxes will shift immediately to a 2 % tax on oil , natural gas , and coal , as well as an increase in fees on the taking of aggregate ( sand and gravel ) and water , directly from our income taxes and the tax on health care .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=This is an issue that is probably best addressed by voters at the municipal level .

#Text=However , the Green Party has a plan to place a moratorium on increases in the assessed market value of residential properties and introduce a Location Value Tax , which will shift the focus from taxing buildings to taxing the land under the buildings .
#Text=This would be a revenue neutral shift with the purpose of encouraging intensification of land use , while deterring sprawl .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=The tax shift from income to resources will mean that labour will be cheaper for employers without a decrease in wages for employees .
#Text=It will also provide an incentive to hire people to find more energy efficient ways of making products since non-renewable energy costs will be higher .

#Text=To encourage the repair and recycling of products the Green Party of Ontario will establish a Product Stewardship Program that will place the responsibility for the entire life cycle of a product with the manufacturer or importer .
#Text=This will encourage the creation of jobs focused on designing products that can be repaired and recycled .
